questions.text: A 45y woman underwent a hysterectomy for multiple intra-uterine fibroids causing heavy bleeding which did not respond to medical management. A cut section of the uterus is as shown. Which of the following statements is correct regarding this scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: HMB would have worsened in the presence of the intra-uterine device

options.label: B
options.text: The intra-uterine device is part of medical management of fibroids

options.label: C
options.text: The intra-uterine device shown is not indicated in fibroid uterus

options.label: D
options.text: The intra uterine device acted as a source of infection thereby worsening the patient’s symptoms

questions.correct_answer: B. The intra-uterine device is part of medical management of fibroids
questions.explanation: Ans.  B) The intra-uterine device is part of medical management of fibroids

questions.text: The image shown depicts the administration of which contraceptive device?
The instruments used as shown are used in?
The instrument shown is used in?

options.label: C
options.text: Insertion of a post placental intra uterine device

options.label: D
options.text: Holding the anterior lip of the cervix

questions.correct_answer: C. Insertion of a post placental intra uterine device
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Insertion of a post placental intra uterine device

questions.text: During a cesarean section, patient started bleeding profusely after the baby was delivered. An obstetric hysterectomy had to be done and this is the image of the hysterectomy specimen. What is the likely reason for PPH?
You are called to the labor room to assist in an emergency. On entering the labor room, you find the patient in a knee chest position as shown. What could the possible complication be?

A patient starts bleeding profusely in the late 1 st stage of labor when the membranes spontaneously rupture. The FHR also drops to 70 bpm. As she is 9 cm, a vacuum is applied, and the baby was quickly delivered and resuscitated. Wondering why there was fetal distress, the placenta is carefully examined and the following seen. What could be the possible diagnosis?
A 32y woman who has recently delivered a baby 2 months back is keen to start Chhaya as a contraceptive method. In which condition should this NOT be given?

A 24y newly married woman has started using Mala N as a contraceptive pill. She visits the OPD very anxious. She had traveled for 5 days and had forgotten to carry the pills. As a result, she has missed the last 3 tablets of the packet and was late in starting a new packet by 2 days, missing a total of 5 tablets. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Take the last missed pill immediately and continue the packet

options.label: B
options.text: Take the last missed pill immediately, continue the packet, use a condom for 7 days and give the emergency pill

options.label: C
options.text: Take the last 2 missed pills and continue the packet

options.label: D
options.text: Take the last missed pill immediately, continue the packet, use a condom for 7 days, give the emergency pill and omit the iron tablets in the current pack

questions.correct_answer: A. Take the last missed pill immediately and continue the packet
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Take the last missed pill immediately and continue the packet

questions.text: The Ezy pill is most effective when taken within ….. hours of last unprotected sex

options.label: D
options.text: Any time till the expected date of next menstrual period

questions.text: A 38y woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhoea which has gradually worsened over the last few months. She has 3 children, the youngest of which is 12 years old. On examination, she is pale. Abdominal exam is normal and on bimanual palpation, the uterus is regularly enlarged. What is the likely diagnosis?
You notice this being used by the consultant in the gyn OPD. What is this image of?

A 23y woman presents to the gyn OPD with the following image done on ultrasound. She had got the ultrasound done for mild abdominal pain in which an incidental ovarian cyst measuring 5 cm (as shown) was diagnosed. Her LMP was 10 days back. What is the next best step?
A 58y woman presents to the OPD with a h/o post menopausal bleeding which was mild and lasted 2 days. An investigation was done which is as shown. What is this investigation?

A 34y woman is undergoing a hysteroscopic myomectomy. The fluid used to distend the uterine cavity is normal saline. During the procedure, the anesthetist informs the fluid deficit is almost 2l. Why is the anesthetist concerned about this fluid deficit?
A 54y woman presents with a uterine prolapse as shown. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduce the prolapse with vaginal packing

questions.correct_answer: A. Reduce the prolapse with vaginal packing
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Reduce the prolapse with vaginal packing

questions.text: How many points and measurement are plotted in the POP-Q staging?

A 56 y woman presents with a history of a vaginal mass which has been increasing since a few months. She had a vaginal hysterectomy for uterine prolapse 10 years earlier. On examination, there is a swelling seen as shown. What is the diagnosis?
A 24y sexually active woman presents to the OPD with complaints of vaginal itching and discharge as shown on speculum exam. There is no foul smell. What is the diagnosis?
A couple presents with infertility. An HSG done shows the following. What is the likely etiology of her infertility?

A 35y woman visits the OPD with her husband. They have been trying to conceive for 8 months. Her cycles are regular. The husband’s semen analysis is normal. Which of the following will help determine her response to treatment?
In which of the following locations is endometriosis least likely to be found?
Which of the following manifestations is most likely encountered during the physical examination of a patient with endometriosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Powder burn lesions on the cervix on speculum exam

options.label: D
options.text: Uterosacral ligament nodularity during bimanual exam

questions.correct_answer: D. Uterosacral ligament nodularity during bimanual exam
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Uterosacral ligament nodularity during bimanual exam

questions.text: Meiosis 1 of the oocytes is completed at which of the following times?
Which line corresponds to progesterone in the chart?

An 18y girl presents with primary amenorrhoea. On examination there is no breast development. There is also no pubic or axillary hair. Her height appears normal. An FSH is done which is high. Ultrasound reveals a uterus. A karyotype is 46 XY. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following hormone “rescues” the corpus luteum from luteolysis?
Which of the following is NOT typical of PCOS?

A 25y old woman presents for infertility evaluation. She reports delayed periods. Her BMI is 27. An ultrasound reveals 15 follicles measuring 2-9 mm per ovary. What would be the next best step in management?
Anti- Mullerian Hormone is involved in all of the following except?

options.label: A
options.text: Regression of the ipsilateral para-mesonephric duct

options.label: B
options.text: Peaking of testosterone production as a result of stimulation of the testes

options.label: C
options.text: Rapid gubernacular growth necessary for testicular descent

options.label: D
options.text: Prediction of successful ovarian stimulation in assisted reproduction

questions.correct_answer: B. Peaking of testosterone production as a result of stimulation of the testes
questions.explanation: Ans. B)Peaking of testosterone production as a result of stimulation of the testes

questions.text: A 14y presents to the emergency with complaints of worsening abdominal pain since a few days. She has been having similar pain lasting for a few days every month since the past few months. Examination reveals a tense lower abdomen, and a local exam is as shown. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 23y with a history of 2 abortions presents for a consultation regarding her multiple miscarriages. Her gynecological consult is otherwise insignificant. During bimanual exam, you note the uterue is markedly deviated to the left. TVS and 3-D USG reveal a single uterue with a banana shaped cavity as shown. What is your diagnosis?
Which is the best treatment option for a woman with a significant decline in the ovarian reserve?

A patient presented to the OPD as a known case of cervical cancer. On further evaluation, the pelvic side wall was found to be involved and hydronephrosis was also seen Identify the stage of cervical cancer
A 14y girl, a victim of rape presents at 22 weeks for abortion. What advice will you give her?

options.label: A
options.text: MTP cannot be done as she has crossed 20 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: MTP can be done till 24 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: MTP can be done only if the mother’s life is at risk

options.label: D
options.text: MTP can only be done if there is a substantial fetal anomaly

questions.correct_answer: B. MTP can be done till 24 weeks
questions.explanation: Ans. B) MTP can be done till 24 weeks

questions.text: You are applying a vacuum to deliver a baby in a patient with prolonged 2 nd stage. The point at which the vacuum is applied is called as the:
A 23y woman with eclampsia is on maintenance dose of MgSO4. Which of these are an indication to STOP MgSO4?
A 23y old woman is in labor. She desires a Copper T to be inserted after delivery. Till when can be inserted?

A 25y woman whose last delivery was 5 years back presents with secondary amenorrhoea of 2 years. She does not have a significant history except for blood transfusion at the time of delivery. A laparoscopy done for cholecystectomy a year earlier revealed mildly enlarged dilated fallopian tubes. On giving estrogen and progesterone, there is no bleeding. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 34y woman presents with dysmenorrhoea and infertility. Laparoscopic finding is as shown. What is the diagnosis?

A 24y primigravida presents at 37 weeks. She has been diagnosed with twin pregnancy, but her pregnancy has been otherwise uncomplicated. On examination the babies are as shown. What would be the next best step?
The type of pelvis commonly associated with obstructed labor is
A 32y G3 is diagnosed to have deep vein thrombosis at 28 weeks. What is the next best step?
A primigravida presents at 36weeks. She is a known case of heart disease with a prosthetic valve on warfarin. What is the next best step?
All are members of the medical board in MTP > 24 weeks except?
A 30y P2L2 woman presents uterocervical. She is not desirous of future fertility. What is the preferred surgery advised?
You are assisting in a vaginal breech delivery. When delivering the head, you use this maneuver. Identify the maneuver
On examining a woman who is 6 weeks pregnant, you note that the vaginal walls is blue. This sign is called as?
Which of the following is not a contra-indication to the procedure shown?

A woman presents at 8 weeks’ pregnancy. This is her 4 th pregnancy. Her 1 st pregnancy was a spontaneous abortion at 2 months amenorrhoea. Her 2 nd pregnancy was a preterm delivery at 30 weeks in view of severe preeclampsia. This was followed by an ectopic pregnancy for which a salpingectomy was done. What is her parity index?
A patient present at 8 weeks for termination of pregnancy. She asks for a medical method of abortion.
A 54y postmenopausal woman presents with abdominal pain. An ultrasound reveals an ovarian mass as shown. A Ca125 done is found to be high. What is the next best step?

Following delivery, a patient was referred with the following image. On examination, there is a tear extending to the external anal sphincter as shown. The tear involves < 50% of the sphincter. This type of tear is

A patient comes after 6 months of a cesarean section with pain at the Pfannenstiel scar site. This pain increases during her periods. On palpation, a nodular lesion is felt. The probable diagnosis is?
A 25y woman with primary infertility is found to have b/l tubal block on HSG. The next best step is?
What is the recommended dose of folic acid that all patients planning pregnancy should take?
Which of the following is NOT an example of a killed or inactivated vaccine and therefore should not be administered during pregnancy?

A 27-year woman, a known epileptic on anti-epileptic drugs, has reported to the OPD. She is planning a pregnancy. Which of the following characteristics make her a candidate for discontinuing the drug?

options.label: B
options.text: She is compliant with medication and maintaining serum drug levels

options.label: C
options.text: She has been seizure free for 18 months

options.label: D
options.text: She has not required an EEG in 18 months

questions.correct_answer: C. She has been seizure free for 18 months
questions.explanation: Ans. C) She has been seizure free for 18 months

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient presents for her 1 st prenatal visit and an initial scan shows the following. Morbidity and mortality in this type of pregnancy results from?
Which of the following concerns regarding international air travel during the 3 rd trimester cannot be mitigated with frequent ambulation?
Caudal regression sequence is increased in which maternal condition?
The following measurement is being taken in a patient with suspected polyhydramnios. To diagnose this, the deepest vertical pocket, must exceed a value of
The components of a biophysical profile include all except?
High resistance flow in the uterine artery at 24 weeks is associated with Stillbirth Abruption Preeclampsia

A 38y G4A3, presents with a positive pregnancy test, vaginal bleeding, palpitations and intense shoulder pain. She is also found to be hypotensive and tachycardic. An ultrasound reveals a likely right ectopic pregnancy. What could be the cause of her shoulder pain?

options.label: B
options.text: Referred pain from her fallopian tube

questions.correct_answer: C. Diaphragmatic irritation because of hemoperitoneum
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Diaphragmatic irritation because of hemoperitoneum

questions.text: You are evaluating a 26y woman in the emergency room presenting with abdominal pain and is found to have a positive UPT. She has tachycardia and hypotension. On ultrasound, you do not identify an intra-uterine pregnancy, and a 3-cm left adnexal mass is identified with moderate complex fluid seen in cul-de-sac. The best management is?
A primigravida is at 9 weeks, presents to the emergency room with vaginal bleeding. She is noted to have an open os and subsequently expels the products shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
Identify the fetal position
When the cervix becomes as thin as the adjacent lower uterine segment, the effacement is
What is true regarding the image shown?

options.label: B
options.text: The forearm is frequently injured in this presentation

options.label: C
options.text: In most cases the fetus will deliver without complications

options.label: D
options.text: There is a higher risk of perineal tears

questions.correct_answer: C. In most cases the fetus will deliver without complications
questions.explanation: Ans. C) In most cases the fetus will deliver without complications

questions.text: You are taking care of a 25y primigravida woman who has just undergone a cesarean section for fetal distress. You had assisted during surgery, and this is the incision given. Before discharge, the patient asks you if she can have a vaginal delivery in the future. Your response is:

options.label: A
options.text: In the next pregnancy, elective repeat cesarean should be done

options.label: B
options.text: In the next pregnancy, a Trial of labor can be given with a risk of rupture being about 0.2%

options.label: D
options.text: In the next pregnancy, a Trial of labor can be given with a risk of rupture being about 5%

questions.correct_answer: B. In the next pregnancy, a Trial of labor can be given with a risk of rupture being about 0.2%
questions.explanation: Ans. B) In the next pregnancy, a Trial of labor can be given with a risk of rupture being about 0.2%

questions.text: A19y G2P1 complains of worsening vulvar pain in the recovery room, 6 hours after delivery. On further evaluation, temp is 37 ° C. Pulse is 130 bpm. BP is 80/50 mmHg and RR is 28/ min. She is pale. Examination reveals the following. What is the next best course of treatment?

options.label: C
options.text: Check a CBC and observe closely

options.label: D
options.text: Broad spectrum antibiotics and an ice pack

questions.text: A 24-year G2A1 at 30 weeks with B-negative blood group gets an ICT done. The report is 1:64. What is the next best step in her management?
questions.correct_answer: C. Perform ultrasound assessment including MCA-PSV
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Perform ultrasound assessment including MCA-PSV

questions.text: A 37 y primigravida is 8 weeks pregnant. She is worried about the risk of her having a baby with Down syndrome as she read that increased age is associated with a higher risk. She has also read that screening can be done once she is pregnant. She wants to opt for a test that has the highest detection rate. What screening test would you recommend?

A 24y primi presents at 30 weeks with abdominal pain. One examination the os is 2 cm dilated and early effaced. She has no additional risk factor and her BP is 110/ 70 mmHg. Tocolytics and corticosteroids are administered. The drug of choice for tocolysis in preterm labor is?
